qas.question: Why did the committee debate adding a shift function?

answers.text: would allow more than 64 codes to be represented by a six-bit code

qas.question: What is different in a shifted code?

answers.text: some character codes determine choices between options for the following character codes

qas.question: Why did they decide against shifting code?

answers.text: less reliable for data transmission as an error in transmitting the shift code typically makes a long part of the transmission unreadable

qas.question: What happened after they decided agasint shifting?

answers.text: ASCII required at least a seven-bit code

plausible_answers.text: would allow more than 64 codes to be represented by a six-bit code

qas.question: Why did the committee debate adding a character code function?

plausible_answers.text: some character codes determine choices between options for the following character codes

qas.question: What is different in a compact code?

plausible_answers.text: less reliable for data transmission as an error in transmitting the shift code typically makes a long part of the transmission unreadable

qas.question: Why did they decide against deleting all the code?

plausible_answers.text: ASCII required at least a seven-bit code

qas.question: What happened after they decided to make all employees work the same schedule?
